snippet: The United Kingdom’s decision not to join the euro zone turned out to be prescient.
abstract: Op-Ed article by British Parliament member John Redwood contends that the United Kingdom's decision not to join the euro zone has turned out to be prescient in light of the current financial crisis; argues that countries that wish to stay in the euro zone must demonstrate the ability to curb their deficits so they can finance themselves at market rates.
lead_paragraph: The United Kingdom’s decision not to join the euro zone turned out to be prescient.
